message.content: This question requires knowledge about safety precautions in a lab setting. Safety goggles are worn to protect the eyes from any potential hazards such as chemicals or substances that may splatter or fly up. Option (A) is incorrect because safety goggles do not give x-ray vision. Option (C) is incorrect because sunglasses or other forms of eye protection would be more appropriate for protecting against the sun. Option (D) is unrelated to the lab setting and therefore not a reason for wearing safety goggles.

This question requires knowledge about safety protocols in a laboratory setting. Safety goggles are worn in a lab to protect the eyes from hazards such as flying liquids or particles, including caustic substances. Option (A) is incorrect because safety goggles do not provide x-ray vision. Option (C) is incorrect because safety goggles are not specifically designed to protect against sunlight. Option (D) is unrelated to the purpose of wearing safety goggles in a lab setting.

This question requires an understanding of lab safety and the potential hazards that can occur while working in a lab. Safety goggles are worn to protect the eyes from any flying debris, chemicals, or substances that can cause harm. Option (A) is incorrect because safety goggles do not give x-ray vision. Option (C) is incorrect because safety goggles are not designed to protect against the sun. Option (D) is irrelevant because safety goggles are not worn to protect against mosquitoes.

Wearing safety goggles in a lab is important for protecting your eyes from potential hazards. Option (B) is the correct answer because caustic liquid and man-made substances can splash or fly up during lab work, posing a risk to your eyes. Safety goggles help create a barrier between your eyes and any potential splashes or airborne substances. Option (A) is incorrect because safety goggles do not give you x-ray vision. Option (C) is incorrect because safety goggles are not designed to protect your eyes from the sun; sunglasses would be more appropriate for that purpose. Option (D) is unrelated to the use of safety goggles in a lab environment.
